entry.title: How to run a local webserver from any directory

link.title: How to run a local webserver from any directory

entry.content:
You may want to run a local webserver to serve static files for testing. It may be your single page app or single html file or any static file.

If you have python3 installed then it can be done using a single command:

python3 -m http.server

This by default runs on port 8000. Optionally you can configure the port by running the following command:

python3 -m http.server 9000

Its a blocking command and you get the access logs for each access from browser to know whats happening:

Serving HTTP on 0.0.0.0 port 8080 (http://0.0.0.0:8080/) ...
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:20] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:20] code 404, message File not found
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:20] "GET /favicon.ico HTTP/1.1" 404 -
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:26] "GET /cloudrun/ HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:27] "GET /cloudrun/2019/ HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:29] "GET /cloudrun/2019/11/ HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:30] "GET /cloudrun/2019/11/22/ HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [23/Nov/2019 12:30:30] "GET /cloudrun/2019/11/22/What-is-cloud-run.html HTTP/1.1" 200 -

Reference:

  • https://docs.python.org/3/library/http.server.html
entry.summary: You may want to run a local webserver to serve static files for testing. It may be your single page app or single html file or any static file.

entry.title: Bundler error
entry.content:
Bundle install results in the following error - seems bundler is not installed properly. gem update command listed below solved the problem.

Command:

bundle install

Error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
	2: from /home/gameon/gems/bin/bundle:23:in `<main>'
	1: from /usr/lib/ruby/2.5.0/rubygems.rb:308:in `activate_bin_path'
/usr/lib/ruby/2.5.0/rubygems.rb:289:in `find_spec_for_exe': can't find gem bundler (>= 0.a) with executable bundle (Gem::GemNotFoundException)

Fix:

sudo gem update --system

Reference:

  • Issue details
entry.summary: Bundle install results in the following error - seems bundler is not installed properly. gem update command listed below solved the problem.

entry.title: What is CloudRun
entry.content:
Cloud run is what i expected Appengine to be - A container plantform without any proprietary API’s or restrictions. Cloudrun recently announced GA.

  • Scale to zero container instances when there is no traffic.
  • Built on Knative and its portable across platforms and minimize lock-in
  • Pay-per use model - pay only for compute used. But you cannot limit the price of cloud run from console - if your app becomes popular overnight you will get a surprise bill unless you configure something like Cost and limits.
  • If you have existing GKE cluster then you can add add-on to use CloudRun in the existing GKE cluster.

CloudRun example

In order to use CloudRun you just need to buld and deploy your application as container with any language/tools of your choice.

  • Build the app
    • Write code
    • Define Docker file
  • Publish Docker image to repo 
    gcloud builds submit --tag gcr.io/myproject/hello

    Published container is submitted to the private continer registery for your project. Its not visible to others.

  • Deploy the docker file to CloudRun 
    gcloud beta run deploy --tag gcr.io/myproject/hello

    Provide service name and region, after successful deployment it shows the

Alternatively you can deploy it to CloudRun on Existing GKE cluster using:

gcloud beta run deploy --tag gcr.io/myproject/hello --cluster=mygkecluster

Cost and limits

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27616776/how-do-i-set-a-cost-limit-in-google-developers-console https://cloud.google.com/apis/docs/capping-api-usage
entry.summary: Cloud run is what i expected Appengine to be - A container plantform without any proprietary API’s or restrictions. Cloudrun recently announced GA.

entry.title: Essential algorithms for interviews
entry.content:
Following are the top list of datastructures and algorithms you must master to confidently clear the technical interviews - this gives a high level map of Data Structure and Algorithms to prepare for interviews.

Algorithms

  • Binary Search
  • Depth First Search (DFS)
  • Breadth First Search (BFS)
  • Sorting
    • Merge sort
    • Quick sort
  • Dynamic Programming
  • Backtracking

Datastructures

  • Hashmap
  • Heap: Max and Min
  • Trie
  • Linked List (single and doubly)
  • Array List
  • Set
  • Stack
  • Queue
  • Binary Search tree
  • Least Recently Used Cache
  • Least Frequently Used Cache
entry.summary: Following are the top list of datastructures and algorithms you must master to confidently clear the technical interviews - this gives a high level map of Data Structure and Algorithms to prepare for interviews.
